title: Records Related to Jeffrey Epstein, Client Lists, and Known Associates

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records, reports, memoranda, notes, emails, interview transcripts, investigative files, and any other materials in the possession of the FBI that reference or relate to:

Jeffrey Epstein’s associates, co-conspirators, or known affiliates

Any "client list" or documented individuals connected to Epstein through criminal investigation, surveillance, flight logs, or seized evidence

Any materials identifying individuals who were investigated in connection with Jeffrey Epstein or his known associates

Any FBI files related to the prosecution, investigation, or handling of Jeffrey Epstein’s activities, including documents after his death

Any materials referencing Ghislaine Maxwell’s trial that pertain to sealed documents or unnamed parties.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tara Hill

title: Ohio Public Records Request – Body-Worn Camera - Arrest of Paige Cox (Aug 23, 2022)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting records related to the arrest of Paige Cox (born 06/08/1994) on August 23, 2022, by the Cincinnati Police Department.

The arrest followed a single-vehicle crash. Ms. Cox refused a chemical test after being read Ohio's ALS form, and was cited under R.C. 4511.19. The arrest occurred in Hamilton County, Ohio.

The involved officers were identified by the following badge numbers:

• Badge P895 – Arresting Officer
• Badge P492 – Witness Officer

The enforcement location was listed as 3201 Warsaw Ave, Cincinnati, OH 45205.

I am requesting:

All body-worn camera (BWC) and dash camera footage from officers P895 and P492 and any related patrol vehicles that were at the scene.

Please provide the records in digital format (via email or downloadable link). If any records are withheld, I request a written explanation citing specific legal exemptions under Ohio law.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

title: "PRO-VACCINATION COMMUNICATION CAMPAIGN" awarded to Zinc Network Ltd

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: "PRO-VACCINATION COMMUNICATION CAMPAIGN" awarded to Zinc Network Ltd
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documents relating to the "PRO-VACCINATION COMMUNICATION CAMPAIGN" awarded to Zinc Network Ltd.

https://www.usaspending.gov/award/CONT_AWD_72011421P00008_7200_-NONE-_-NONE-

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dickon Jackson
